Key Match Events: JJ Redick’s debut as the new coach of the LA Lakers resulted in a 124-107 loss to the Minnesota Timberwolves.
The Lakers played without LeBron James and Anthony Davis, while the Timberwolves didn’t have Anthony Edwards and Julius Randle.
The Lakers lost the possession battle and had 21 turnovers, five more than Minnesota.
The Timberwolves' frontcourt, featuring Rudy Gobert and Naz Reid, dominated the rebounding battle 41-38.
Post-Match Reflections: JJ Redick was happy with how his team competed but noted they were 'destroyed in the possession battle.'
Redick was encouraged by how his players competed, even when they went down big early.
Redick kept his promise to run more sets with the Lakers, moving away from the 'random' playing style of last season.
